description: Validate graceful handling of research-specific edge cases (from research-sites merge).

tests.name: Unknown Page Type
tests.prompt: Research components for an onboarding wizard page
expectations: Skill does NOT refuse or error out
Maps to nearest known type or creates a reasonable section list
Output still follows per-page table format with #, Section, Component, Style, Link, Complexity
Asks clarifying question if page type is truly ambiguous
tests.pass_criteria: Valid table output or clarifying question. Never a refusal.
fail_indicators: Error output instead of table or clarifying question

tests.name: Unreachable Source Site
tests.setup: Research triggers WebFetch on a URL that returns 404 or timeout
expectations: Skip the unreachable source and continue with remaining sources
Do NOT include broken links in the output table
Do NOT hallucinate component details from an unreachable page
Output contains results from at least 2 other working sources
tests.pass_criteria: No broken links in final table. Research completes with available sources.
fail_indicators: Broken links in the output table
Hallucinated component details from unreachable page
Research fails entirely due to one unreachable source

tests.name: Framework-Specific Filtering
tests.prompt: Research landing page components for Vue/Nuxt (not React)
expectations: Prioritize Vue-compatible sources (Inspira UI, general CSS solutions)
Exclude React-only libraries (Aceternity, Magic UI) or note incompatibility
Still follow the standard table format
Link column points to Vue-compatible component pages
tests.pass_criteria: No React-only components presented without a compatibility note.
fail_indicators: React-only components listed without compatibility note

tests.name: Single Section Deep Dive
tests.prompt: Find 5 hero section variants for my landing page
expectations: Output is a single table focused on hero sections only
Contains at least 5 rows, all Section = "Hero"
Each row shows a distinct variant (Aurora, Parallax, Video, 3D, Kinetic, etc.)
Descriptions below the table differentiate each variant clearly
tests.pass_criteria: >= 5 hero variants, all distinct styles, single-section table.

tests.name: Follow-Up Numbering Continuity
tests.setup: User first requests landing page research (gets #1-#6), then asks "show me more"
expectations: Additional results continue numbering from #7 onward
No duplicate components from the first batch
New results come from deeper or different search queries
Table format remains identical to the first batch
tests.pass_criteria: Numbering continues without gaps or duplicates.
fail_indicators: Duplicate components from the first batch

tests.name: Empty Search Results
tests.setup: Research a very niche section type with likely no results from standard sources
expectations: If no results found from standard sources, report honestly
Suggest alternative search terms or related components
Do NOT fabricate component names or URLs
Offer to broaden the search
tests.pass_criteria: No fabricated links. Honest "no results" with suggestions.
fail_indicators: No suggestion to broaden search or try alternatives
